newsitem.title: UK: Trimble says British N.Ireland office duplicitous.
newsitem.headline: Trimble says British N.Ireland office duplicitous.

text.p: David Trimble, head of Northern Ireland's most powerful pro-British Unionist party, said on Monday that Britain had shown massive duplicity in handling the issue of how guerrillas should surrender their arms.
"We are dealing with duplicity from the Northern Ireland Office on a massive scale," Trimble told BBC Radio Ulster ahead of crunch talks with British Prime Minister Tony Blair.

It was Trimble's first public comment since the Irish Republican Army declared a weekend ceasefire to its 28-year war against British rule of Northern Ireland to earn its Sinn Fein political wing a seat at Belfast peace talks.
Trimble said that he would be seeking reassurances from Blair that the IRA would have to hand over or decommission some weapons as part of the peace process.
He said the IRA had called the truce because Sinn Fein had been given to understand by Britain that it would not have to secure the handover of any IRA arms during the talks.
